results.title: The Fifth Estate
results.creator_credit: Participant Media, Reliance Entertainment, Touchstone Pictures, Anonymous Content, DreamWorks Pictures, Steve Golin, Bill Condon, Michael Sugar and Josh Singer
results.headline_credit: Belgium, India and United States of America, 2013
results.brief_description: A look at the relationship between WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange and his early supporter and eventual colleague Daniel Domscheit-Berg, and how the website’s growth and influence led to an irreparable rift between the two friends.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.title: The Fifth element [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Patrick Ledoux, Columbia and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The Fifth Element takes an amazing glimpse into the future, with wonderful visual effects from the people who gave us “Titanic”, “Nikita” and “The Professional”, and unique costumes by visionary designer, Jean-Paul Gaultier. If the four elements are fire, water, earth and air, what is the Fifth element? What does it do? Who has control of it? These questions and others are answered as the film unfolds at a breath taking pace. This film takes you on a sci-fi thrill ride of the decade. Bruce Willis, a taxi-driver in New York city in the 23rd Century is selected as our hero. He will travel to the end of the galaxy to decide the fate of our universe. Cast includes Gary Oldman, Milla Jovovich, Ian Holm and Chris Tucker.

results.brief_description: A vivid exposition of the basis of the Buddhist Tantra, this visual documentary builds a picture of the Tibetan Buddhists’ view of the world.

results.title: The Field mouse
results.creator_credit: Steve Helling and Scandinavian Videocassette Group
results.brief_description: The life cycle, habits and characteristics of the field mouse are shown in the context of its ecosystem. Highlights factors such as food availability, predators, population levels and adaptive behaviour. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Field day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adults Learning”.
A teaching aid to promote group discussion on the problems of the adult learning process in the management-staff relations. Shows a gathering at a rural agricultural field day. The film seems to be pointing out that resistance to new ideas is hard to overcome.

results.title: The Field
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Noel Pearson and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: Bull McCabe (Richard Harris) and his son Tadgh (Sean Bean) have sacrificed their lives for the sake of turning the land of a local widower into a successful field but when she says she wants to sell to the highest bidder at public auction, there is no guarantee that the McCabe’s history with the land will guarantee future ownership. Bull’s biggest fear that the field will be taken over by an outsider becomes a reality when “The American” (Tom Berenger) arrives in their small Irish town. Without any cash or other means at their disposal, the only resistance the McCabes can offer is violence, continuing a trend of tragedy that has dogged the family for years. Brenda Fricker co-stars as Bull’s silent and long suffering wife, John Hurt as the simpleton “Bird”. Set in Ireland in the 1930s and based on the play “The Field” by John B. Keane.

results.title: The Fiddlers of James Bay
results.creator_credit: Bob Rodgers, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Scots from the Orkney Islands came to trade in Northern Quebec during the 17th century. They brought fiddles with them and introduced a new form of music to the Cree of James Bay. The music survived long after the Scots returned home. In this film two Cree fiddlers travel to the Orkney Islands, the birthplace of the music they learned from their fathers and grandfathers. The film captures the warmth and good will of this reunion.

results.title: The Fibre web
results.creator_credit: Henry Cooper, Alan Harper and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: Shows the manufacture of high-quality paper in Scotland, and its uses throughout the world. Today, the uses of paper extend beyond visible applications for books, or maps, labels, or cheques, to become the insulators for telephone cables, giant transformers or computers. Narrated by Kenneth Horne.
